biography.value:
Deep in the fog and muck of the swamp, the students of Witherbloom College—first as apprentices and then as witherbloom pledgemage;pledgemages—study the cycle of life and death. Their magic is fueled by what they call life essence: the ubiquitous energy that runs through living things.

Witherbloom students learn how to concoct magical potions and talismans, in addition to their spellcasting studies. Their magic ranges from necrotic shadows and withering bursts of poison to flourishing bursts of plant life.

Witherbloom Scholars

Witherbloom College studies the magic inherent in the natural cycle of life and death. Witherbloom professors approach the philosophy from different directions, with one methodology focusing on decay and the other dealing with growth.

description.value: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d8 type=poison average=true]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the apprentice can pull it up to 10 feet closer to itself.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} as the spellcasting ability:

At will: druidcraft, spare the dying

1/day each: pass without trace

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regeneration. The apprentice regains [[/damage 5 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Verdant Talisman. At the end of a 10-minute &Reference[ritual]{ritual}, the apprentice can touch one willing creature (including itself) and bestow upon it a small talisman imbued with magic. Upon receiving the talisman, the creature gains 10 temporary hit points, and it can add 1d6 to its initiative rolls while it wears the talisman. These benefits last for 1 hour or until the apprentice conducts another &Reference[ritual]{ritual} to bestow another talisman. When the benefits expire, the talisman crumbles to dust.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

When the apprentice sees a creature within 30 feet of itself drop to 0 hit points, the apprentice channels the expended life essence and targets another creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a [[/save con 12 format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} for 1 minute. While &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} in this way, the target takes [[/damage 1d6 type=poison average=true]] damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Whispering to the spirits of &Reference[nat]{nature}, you create one of the following effects within range:

  • You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
  • You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}.
  • You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on &Reference[undead]{undead} or constructs.

A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.
